title: Why do bans reduce LP?
body: I got a 14 day ban off of chat logs reported by players. I really don't care about the ban. My problem however is that I got banned, while in queue. I was in my promo series so I lost my promos and 10 LP because of the ban. Since there isn't anyone reviewing a ban, it should be instantaneous if its going to happen. Its absurd to ban someone mid queue and punish them because you allowed them to queue. If you get banned mid queue, why does it still count as a dodge?

replies.body: Because you still dodged. You caused it directly with your misbehavior. It’s not anyone else’s fault.
I didn't dodge. In any case, you should not be able to queue if your reports are going through the automated system.
It’s your choice to queue up. Riot is not going to make innocent players wait 10 minutes just for false reporters to be thrown out
That should be the least of your worries right now. Should be worried about being permabanned instead.

In addition to that, promos don't mean anything. If you're placed low, you'll climb. If high, you'll drop. Otherwise your division rank in League of Legends is nothing more than a colored helmet that pretty much only you look at.
If you get banned for chat you were being wildly abusive, I'd drop you to iron where you belong
It was player reports, so no.
